wikipedia_page.main: William Stewart Chalmers (5 March 1907 – 13 November 1989) was a Scottish amateur football inside right who played for Queens Park, Heart of Midlothian, Manchester United, Dunfermline Athletic and the Scottish national team.

response: Home Scots: Jack Harkness (Queen's Park); Dougie Gray (Rangers), Willie McStay (captain, Celtic); James Kennedy (Falkirk), Alec Lambie (Partick Thistle), Tully Craig (Rangers); Peter Gavigan (St Johnstone), Stewart Chalmers (Queen's Park), David McCrae (St Mirren), Bob McPhail (Airdrieonians), Adam McLean (Celtic).

Born in Bellshill, Scotland, as a player Chalmers appeared for various clubs as a forward. After starting out in Glasgow with Queen's ParkChalmers, William, QPFC.com (7 appearances, 1 goal in the source attributed to Billy during the 1924-25 Scottish Division One season should be credited to Stewart Chalmers, who played in the same position and joined Queen's Park about the same time Billy moved to Rangers). then Rangers (where he won the 1924–25 Scottish Division One title in his first season with the club but then fell out of favour),Rangers player Chalmers, William, FitbaStats he was transferred to Newcastle United in March 1928 for £2,500.
